home
Class Home

java.lang.Object
  home.Home

public class Home
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the smart home itself in the gui context. It stores its items and its own view. The home also stores the axis vector of the plane, on which the items - and the camera - can be moved in 3-dimensional space.

Version:
20110919
Author:
langenhagen

Method Detail

loadState

public boolean loadState()
Loads the state (meaning the position-offsets of the items and such stuff) of this home according to the set StateReader.
Caution: In order to provoke no crash, a valid StateReader has to be set with the method setStateReader()!

Returns:
Returns TRUE, if loading was successful, otherwise returns FALSE.

saveState

public boolean saveState()
Saves the state (meaning the position-offsets of the items and such stuff) of this home according to the set StateWriter. Caution: In order to provoke no crash, a valid StateWriter has to be set with the method setStateWriter()!.

Returns:
Returns TRUE, if saving was successful, otherwise returns FALSE.

getView

public MT3DObject getView()
Gets the view

Returns:
obj The view as an MT3DObject

getItem

public Item getItem(java.lang.String id)
Retrieves the item with the given name, if it doesn't exist, null will be returned.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the Item's PhysicalDevice as a String.
Returns:
Returns an Item or NULL if an item with the specified name doesn't exist.

getAllItems

public java.lang.Iterable<Item> getAllItems()
Returns all items in this home.

Returns:
All items as an Iterable of type Item.

removeItem

public Item removeItem(java.lang.String id)
Removes the itemID from the set of items.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the Item's PhysicalDevice as a String.
Returns:
Thw Item associated with the ID, or null if there was no mapping for id.

setMovingPlaneNormal

public void setMovingPlaneNormal(org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D normal)
Sets the axis of the moving plane On which items can be moved along in the smart home (in global coordinates). This axis also makes translations rotations around this normal possible.

Parameters:
normal - The axis vector of the moving-plane as a Vector3D.

setMovingPlaneNormal

public void setMovingPlaneNormal(org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D normal,
                                 org.mt4j.components.MTComponent comp)
Sets the axis of the moving plane On which items can be moved along in the smart home. This axis also makes translations rotations around this normal possible.

Parameters:
normal - The axis vector of the moving-plane as a Vector3D.
comp - An MTComponent to which the normal is relative to. Can be NULL for global coordinates.

getMovingPlaneNormal

public org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D getMovingPlaneNormal()
Retrieves the axis of the moving plane On which items can be moved along in the smart home.

Returns:
The axis vector of the moving-plane as a Vector3D.

public void setStateReader(StateReader reader)
Sets the reader, which can load this home's state.

Parameters:
reader - The reader as a StateReader.

setStateWriter

the home's name as a String.

setActiveItem

public void setActiveItem(java.lang.String itemID)
Sets the active itemID of this home.

Parameters:
itemID - The name of the itemID as a String. If the given string doesn't belong to an itemID in this home or is empty, the active itemID will be set to NULL.

getActiveItem

public Item getActiveItem()
Retrieves the active item.

Returns:
The active itemID as an Item or NULL, if there is no active item.

setMaxMovementRadius

public void setMaxMovementRadius(float radius)
Sets the maximum movement radius in which the home can be moved around. Also forwards this radius to its items.

Parameters:
radius - The maximum movement radius in global coordinates as a float.

getMaxMovementRadius

public float getMaxMovementRadius()
Retrieves the maximum movement radius in which the home can be moved around.

Returns:
The maximum movement radius in global coordinates as a float.
